channel.title: Port Forwarding Help!
channel.description:
Ok, well i have hosted servers before, but lost everything since i kinda killed my HDD :fp:
Im Running: Windows 7 32bit
I have added the exceptions to allow the port 43594 inbound and outbound. Also, i have configured my router[BELKIN] to allow the port (which i think i have done correctly):
[img]http://screensnapr.com/e/iv5LBp.png[/img]
[size=24pt]However, the port is still shown closed:[/size]
[img]http://img600.imageshack.us/img600/1347/portclosed.png[/img]
So, has any got any tips, or even better how to solve this problem?? I really want my server up and running :/

item.title: Port Forwarding Help!
item.dc:creator: @go_armand go armand
item.description:
@go_armand wrote:

Are you sure your firewall isnt blocking it?
Also, make sure the 101 at the end is the right number.
type ipconfig in your windows cmd and find the right one.

Read full topic
